result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jack R Handeland

records.addlTxt: Atty Campbell Hunter
Order on PFAC, repayment at the rate of $50 per month, with the first payment due 12/15/22
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 11:15 AM 
Defendant Jack R Handeland in court.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Jack R Handeland.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Campbell indicates that Mr. Handeland has prepared PFAC, and is prepared to submit. 

Atty Campbell requests a plea & sentencing date be scheduled. 

The Court discharges Atty Campbell as Mr. Handeland is no longer SPD eligible. 

Atty Campbell indicates that she intends to inquire about county appointment so that she can finish case with Mr. Handeland. 
recess: 11:23pm--reconvene: 11:49am
Atty Campbell indicates that the Clerk of Court has allowed continued appointment. 

Scheduling is discussed. 
NEXT: Plea & Sentencing on 12/9/22 at 11:30am
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
FINANCIAL NOTES: $30.00 ALP payment received - Attorney Fees
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

[ma] Case called at 9:02 AM 
Defendant Jack R Handeland in court.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Jack R Handeland.  Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Campbell indicates that a resolution has not been reached, requests one final status be scheduled. 
--no objection from ADA Parson 

The Court directs Mr. Handeland to contact SPD office by noon today, to have appointment converted to public defender appointment. 
recess: 9:05am
NEXT: Status on 10/27/22 at 11:00am
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 2:03pm 
Defendant Jack R Handeland appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.  ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Handeland gives explanation for non appearance, notes he turned himself into jail. 

The Court reinstates bond. 
recess 2:06pm   pm. 

NEXT: Status Conference on 9/26/22 at 9:00am
Extradition Forecast
Returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate.

[MK] case called at briefly 10:56am, and then at 11:22am 
Defendant Jack R Handeland not in court.  Attorney Shunette Campbell Hunter in court.  ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
This case is scheduled for Status Conference.  Attorney Campbell Hunter indicates that she has not been able to reach Mr. Handeland today.  She reports that after the last hearing Mr. Handeland cooperated with her to obtain certain records. 
The Court issues a Warrant-Body Only, returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate.  

The Court notes that the Court ordered a direct-appointment of Attorney Campbell Hunter as counsel, and that Mr. Handeland is eligible for PD representation.  Attorney Campbell Hunter's appointment as counsel for Mr. Handeland is to be converted from a court appointment to an appointment via PD services. Mr. Handeland will need to contact the Public Defender's Office for this to occur. 
Attorney Campbell Hunter indicates that when she is in contact with Mr. Handeland, she will tell him that he needs to go to the Public Defender's Office to re-apply for representation.
recess 11:24am

Pre-trial conference on August 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[MK] case called at 11:37am
Defendant Jack R Handeland in court with Attorney Shunette Campbell Hunter.  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing and the State's deputy-witness is present, however the Defense submits a preliminary hearing waiver form. 
Mr. Handeland waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 11:45am

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on August 17th at 10:00am--only counsel need to appear,  (2) Status Conference on August 29th at 10:30am--JA please note in calendar comments that the clerk should provide Mr. Handeland with a hearing assistance device
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.

[MK] case called at 2:59pm 
Defendant Jack R Handeland in court with Attorney Shunette Campbell Hunter. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Campbell Hunter confirms that she is accepting the appointment as counsel. The Court requires Mr. Handeland to make $30 monthly installment payments toward reimbursement of attorney fees commencing on 9/1/22 and on the first day of each month thereafter until further order. 
Attorney Campbell Hunter indicates that the Defense has received a plea offer; she requests the scheduling of another status conference.  
After discussion with counsel, the Court schedules the case for preliminary hearing. 
recess 3:04pm  

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on August 2nd at 11:30am
Status conference on July 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Attorney Campbell Hunter

[ma] Case called at 12:04 PM 
Defendant Jack R Handeland in court.  Michael C. Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Handeland asserts that he is eligible for public defender representation

The Court will appoint counsel for Mr. Handeland; the Court diercts Attorney Campbell Hunter to be appointed. 

recess: 12:07pm 
NEXT: Status on 7/15/22 at 2:30pm
Status conference on July 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.

[ae] case called 02:32 PM Defendant Jack R Handeland in court. DA Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court directs SPD to continue efforts in securing counsel for Defendant. The Court continues to toll time limits. Defendant confirms mailing address. 
recess: 2:34 pm
NEXT: STC on 7/1/22 at 11:30 am
Status of Counsel
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on May 4, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Status conference on June 2, 2022 at 02:15 pm. {Hearing date/time is different than what was provided in court due to a change in the Court's calendar; new date coordinated with counsel. -AR}

-  No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
 -  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
 -  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
 -  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

[ml] Case called at 1:24PM
Defendant Jack R Handeland appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Upon Court inquiry, the Defendant advises that the address is mostly correct, noting that the address should read Lakeview Drive, rather than Lakeview Lane.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
 -  No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
 -  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
 -  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
 -  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

recess 1:28PM

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 05/04 at 9:40AM  (2) Status Conference on 05/27 at 8:30AM
